Radius and area

We should all be familiar with the concept of the radius and area of a circle. The idea of this section is to remind you of how to calculate the area of a circle as well as go through some examples relating to these concepts. Recall that if we have a circle of radius \(r\) then its area is given by \[ \mbox{Area} = A = \pi r^2. \]


Example

Given that the circumference of a circle is \(18\pi\)cm find its area.

Solution

Recall that the circumference of a circle is given by \(2\pi r\). Here we have \(36\pi = 2 \pi r\) and so rearranging gives \(r = 9\). The area of a circle is given by \(A = \pi r^2\) and so here we have \[ A = \pi \cdot (9)^2 = 81\pi. \]
